runs.comm: starts on leg stump and that's a nice freebie for Shehzad to start the chase as he flicks it wide of short fine leg
full, straighter, clipped sweetly to midwicket where Jordan dives to make the save
pushed square to point
way down the leg side
adjusts to a full length outside off, onto the front foot and driven to mid-off
that's an ugly heave as he comes down the pitch and swings across the line of a length ball. Not the smartest piece of batting
hint of swing, but pushed down the leg side again
and another wide down the leg side, not great stuff from Willey
oh dear, it's going all wrong here since the wicket, this one is full and down the leg side again...long over. How many left Willey asks the umpire. Still one, David

would you believe it?! Another run out. Well, of course you would believe it. Willey managed to get the ball straighter, it was nicely driven through. Hafeez wanted the second run but Rafatullah wasn't convinced and it's another shambles. And, again, they have to work out who is run out. Comical scenes. Has Hafeez crossed with Rafatullah and the opposite to end to where the stumps were broken? Still waiting (grab a drink, folks). And it's Hafeez that has to go.
full, angled into the bats, clipped to midwicket
angled into the pads again, a nicely-timed flick and Moeen dives at midwicket...almost another mix-up in the running
inside edge into the pad leads to a strangled shout
driven into the off side, another one-handed diving save from Jordan at cover
a bouncer over middle and leg, he ducks
fuller on the stumps, he comes forward and gets a thick inside edge to the leg side
back of a length on off stump, punched towards mid-off
given! He went a long way across the stumps, aiming to flick to the leg side, he misses and was struck around middle and leg on first glance
that's a strong shot, full and wide outside off, he leans into a very pleasing cover drive which makes a lovely sound off the bat
forward and pushes to mid-off
short of a length, hops onto the back foot, played square into the off side
touch fuller, brings him forward, pushed firmly to the covers
short of a length outside off, Malik going for the cut and gets beaten over the top edge
tight line, on off stump, short of a length again and defended on the back foot
nearly chops this one into his stumps from the bottom, trying to force into the off side with a square bat
that's a top shot, uses his feet, comes down on a line outside leg stump and cracks this away square through the covers
opens the face and runs it down to third man
full and straight, tucked to the right of mid-on
works a straight delivery to mid-on
that was a quite a sharp delivery, short of a length outside off, manages to jab it away off the top edge towards thirdman
works off the stumps into square leg
good from Woakes, full, just outside off, Rizwan punches to the on side
pulls away a short ball from a slightly crouched position
that's nicely played, lifted over the on side with a neat flick of the wrists
low full toss outside off, driven to cover and an uncertain single is eventually taken
dropped into the backward point away, bounces nicely for Roy who can't collect cleanly
takes advantage of some width outside off, throws his hands through a cut shot and it comes off a thick top edge fine of third man
short this time and superbly pulled, off one leg, behind square...terrific shot
full at off stumps, drilled into the pitch and back to the bowler
poor delivery, think it was a slower ball that he dragged down short outside stump and it was swung away to long leg
wide outside off, cut behind point and deep cover scoots around the boundary
dragged down a little short, he rocks back and pulls one bounce to deep midwicket
and he pulls as well, straighter this time and finds long on
flicked away from leg stump into midwicket
big spin! Lovely delivery, flighted on middle stump, grips and turns square past the outside edge
a very full delivery, he sweeps and gets a top edge but it lands short of deep square...steady start from Rashid
turns into the pads, quite sharply, flicked to short fine leg
sharp spin and bounce, goes down the leg side...called wide. I don't agree with that. Started on off stump
he's forward and this one grips to take the inside edge onto pad
nudged with the significant turn into square leg
flicked through square leg
this one rags in from outside off, a good two feet outside off, and Rizwan ends up jabbed the bat down on it outside leg stump...huge spin
swept to deep backward square

lovely catch! Sharp snaffle off his own bowling. The batsman isn't walking off. Wants to see if it has carried. Aiming to work a full delivery into the leg side, gets a leading edge low back to Rashid to his left. The umpires have gone upstairs, the soft signal is out. Rashid goes one handed, does he get the finger underneath it? The more replays we see, in slow-mo, the more the doubt grows. Batsman might survive here. The angle from behind shows the fingers under the ball. Instinct is out, but you never know. No we have it zoomed in. Not sure that helps or adds more doubt. And he's been given! Cricket instinct says that was clean.
goes onto the back foot and whips this through midwicket
full on middle, driven back to the bowler
beaten by more sharp spin as he fiddles outside off from the back foot
googly which is worked off the back foot into the leg side
defends a very full delivery almost off the back foot, not sure if he misread the length...nicely bowled
worked into the leg side
flicked away from outside off to short fine leg
very full, worked down the ground
worked through square leg
sharp spin from outside off, an appeal for lbw but he was struck outside off stump I think
presses forward outside off, pushed into the covers
down the pitch and that's a meaty blow over long on...got to the pitch and clubbed through the line
quicker and flatter, flicked out to deep midwicket
tries to work this into the leg side, the spin means he gets a leading edge which loops wide of the bowler
full at the stumps, eased down the ground to long on
a googly, played off the back foot into the leg side
flicked back down the pitch and Rashid fields himself
another fantastic catch! Jordan at deep midwicket this time, running to his left. Akmal went for the slog sweep to a ball outside off, it was a skimming shot and Jordan gathered it superbly
flicked from well outside off to short fine leg
touch shorter, on the back foot and flipped through the leg side
gentle first ball, just eases this from outside off into the leg side with a closed face
comes down the pitch and almost struggles to reach this as Moeen bowls it wider, Afridi just reaches it at full stretch and clears point
defended to the off side
goes to a pull a short delivery but doesn't make contact and is taken high on the pad...was another googly
what a ripper! That has pitched outside leg and spun square past Afridi's bat
low full toss this time and Afridi clubs it over long on...not the longest boundaries to clear
good response, flatter outside off, spins quite sharply to beat the outside edge
full at off stump, pushed into the covers

that's a superb shot, textbook footwork from Malik as he gets to the pitch and crunches this straight back past the stumps, along the ground...Rashid tried to get a hand on it, to no avail. Splits long off and long on
sweeps a straight delivery, good connection but picks out backward square leg
hits the stands! A huge blow from Afridi. That's a mighty slog sweep and he takes it from outside off over deep midwicket
appeal for lbw this time as he misses the sweep on this occasion
worked from outside off to midwicket inside the circle
and now it's Malik's turn...these two giving it a crack. Makes it into a full toss by coming down the pitch and heaves it over long on
steps back to a shorter ball, waits for it to turn and dabs square into the off side...sensible cricket
gets a touch of fortune as he heaves across the line of a full delivery and the inside edge scoots past the stumps to fine leg
this is a wonderfully controlled edge this time, outstanding stroke, he opened the face late and dabbed it wide of the keeper. Lovely touch.
short delivery outside off, angle towards third man again and the placement is excellent which allows him a second
nips back into him from short of a length but he's able to glance it to third man and that brings up a very fine half-century
gets across the crease and a calmly works this through square leg
a bouncer over off stump, Malik sways out of the line...was he hoping for a wide call? It was okay for the umpires
gone with a hit! Full on middle, pushed into the covers and he has to dive to make his ground...Morgan came across from cover, slid and makes an under-arm flick which would have found Afridi short
slower ball worked into the vacant midwicket area so Willey chases it himself
charges down the pitch, Willey pulls the length back, slugged down the ground
full outside leg, pushed firmly down the ground
HUGE! Out of the ground...that's on the road to Dubai. Dropped in short by Willey, Afridi was waiting in his crease this time and plundered it over deep midwicket. Think it's still travelling.
a slower ball full at the pads, clipped into the leg side...that single brings up the fifty stand from 29 balls
gloves, or bottom edges, a pull down the leg side...terrific attempt by Buttler to pull in the catch, one-handed with his left glove, but he managed to take the pace off the ball
lovely batting, if only for a single, as he walks across the crease to a full toss and flicks it with such good timing that it almost carries to deep square
low full toss outside off is driven square through the off side and Vince, coming from deep cover, can't haul it in

another low full toss, this time it's driven straighter and deep cover has to run the other way...has Vince flicked this back? Wonderful effort if so. Oh, that's a brilliant. He was running at full pelt but managed to keep the ball in the field of play
gets a yorker in outside leg stump, well bowled, jabbed into midwicket
another full toss, outside off again, and that's hammered towards deep cover but straight to the man on the boundary
drags a length ball down to long on, lost his shape on that shot
goes across the crease and clips a full, straight delivery to deep square

taken leg stump! Silence (relatively speaking) from the crowd. Afridi going to sweep a delivery which was not that full, he had moved a long away across, he missed and leg stump as clipped. Was a touch slower, too, at 71mph
full outside off, stays in his crease and clubs it to long on
oh, fantastically played, he advanced down the pitch, the delivery was back of a length, he opened the face and bisected backward point and short third man
finds the gap again, those two deliveries swing it back Pakistan's way, Malik pulls a short delivery and slots it between deep midwicket and deep square
full toss outside off is driven to deep cover...that's fine from Tanvir
full toss outside off, crashed square through the off side and deep cover is able to keep it to a single
full and straight, sweetly driven back down the pitch, Jordan flings himself to his right in his follow through and finger-tips it towards mid-off
gets the yorker bang on target this time, outside off, Malik swings hard and the ball bounces back to Jordan. Priceless dot ball
down to third man! Swinging himself off his feet. Throwing the bat at a wide delivery, flies off the top edge fine of third man. Advantage Pakistan again
big full toss...is it a no-ball? Malik swings wildly and it bobbles to the off side. Borderline for waist height and Jordan gets away with it
full at the stumps, he can only heave to long on for a single...over to Tanvir
that should just about seal it! Can't get the ball full enough, it's on a length at off stump and Tanvir strikes beautifully through the line over long on
dot ball! It was length again, wider outside off, Tanvir tried to swing through the leg side and couldn't make contact
clubbed towards mid-off and they scamper the run which brings Malik back into strike
he's found long on! This game isn't over yet. He opts for the glory shot, trying to clear the boundary, but he can't get the leverage and it's a simple catch

it's a bye! We have a Super Over! They are checking for the run out but think Tanvir made it. Yes, he has! He missed his heave, Buttler gathered - he was standing back - and opted to under-arm (he didn't already have his glove off) to the non-striker's end because Anwar Ali had made such a head start on the run
